annotations.description: Edge VPC with VPN and Bastion servers

variables.name: ibmcloud_api_key
variables.description: The IBM Cloud api key

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the resource group

variables.name: sync
variables.description: Value used to order the provisioning of the resource group

outputs.name: name
outputs.description: The name of the resource group

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The id of the resource group

outputs.name: group
outputs.description: The resource group object

outputs.name: sync
outputs.description: Value used to order the provisioning of the resource group

outputs.name: provision
outputs.description: Flag indicating that the resource group was provisioned by this module

outputs.name: tags
outputs.description: Flag indicating that the resource group was provisioned by this module

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: Resource group where the cluster has been provisioned.

variables.name: region
variables.description: Geographic location of the resource (e.g. us-south, us-east)

variables.name: tags
variables.description: Tags that should be applied to the service

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The prefix name for the service. If not provided it will default to the resource group name

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that key-protect instance should be provisioned

variables.name: name
variables.description: The name that should be used for the service, particularly when connecting to an existing service. If not provided then the name will be defaulted to {name prefix}-{service}

variables.name: private_endpoint
variables.description: Flag indicating that the service should be created with private endpoints

variables.name: number_of_crypto_units
variables.description: No of crypto units that has to be attached to the instance.

variables.name: service
variables.description: The name of the KMS provider that should be used (keyprotect or hpcs)

outputs.description: The id of the provisioned instance.

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the resource group for which the access groups will be created

variables.name: ibmcloud_api_key
variables.description: The api key used to access IBM Cloud

variables.name: page_limit
variables.description: The number of access groups to return per request (this is mostly used for testing)

outputs.name: resource_group_name
outputs.description: The resource group name

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the IBM Cloud resource group where the VPC instance will be created.

variables.name: region
variables.description: The IBM Cloud region where the cluster will be/has been installed.

variables.name: name
variables.description: The name of the vpc instance

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The name of the vpc resource

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the instance should be provisioned. If false then an existing instance will be looked up

variables.name: address_prefix_count
variables.description: The number of ipv4_cidr_blocks

variables.name: address_prefixes
variables.description: List of ipv4 cidr blocks for the address prefixes (e.g. ['10.10.10.0/24']). If you are providing cidr blocks then a value must be provided for each of the subnets. If you don't provide cidr blocks for each of the subnets then values will be generated using the {ipv4_address_count} value.

variables.name: base_security_group_name
variables.description: The name of the base security group. If not provided the name will be based on the vpc name

variables.name: internal_cidr
variables.description: The cidr range of the internal network

variables.name: tags
variables.description: Tags that should be added to the instance

outputs.name: name
outputs.description: The name of the vpc instance

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The id of the vpc instance

outputs.name: acl_id
outputs.description: The id of the network acl

outputs.name: crn
outputs.description: The CRN for the vpc instance

outputs.name: count
outputs.description: The number of VPCs created by this module. Always set to 1

outputs.name: names
outputs.description: The name of the vpc instance

outputs.name: ids
outputs.description: The id of the vpc instance

outputs.name: base_security_group
outputs.description: The id of the base security group to be shared by other resources. The base group is different from the default security group.

outputs.name: addresses
outputs.description: The ip address ranges for the VPC

variables.name: resource_group_id
variables.description: The id of the resource group where the flow logs will be provisioned

variables.name: cos_bucket_name
variables.description: Cloud Object Storage bucket name for flow logs

variables.name: target_count
variables.description: The number of resources for which flow logs will be created

variables.name: target_ids
variables.description: The ids of the target resources for the flow log

variables.name: target_names
variables.description: The names of the target resources for the flow logs

variables.name: auth_id
variables.description: The id of the service authorization that allows the flow log to write to the cos bucket

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the subnet should be provisioned. If 'false' then the subnet will be looked up.

outputs.name: count
outputs.description: The number of flow logs created

outputs.name: ids
outputs.description: The ids of the generated flow logs

outputs.name: names
outputs.description: The names of the generated flow logs

variables.name: resource_group_id
variables.description: The id of the IBM Cloud resource group where the VPC gateways will be created.

variables.name: region
variables.description: The IBM Cloud region where the cluster will be/has been installed.

variables.name: vpc_name
variables.description: The name of the vpc instance

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the gateway must be provisioned

variables.name: tags
variables.description: Tags that should be added to the instance

outputs.name: count
outputs.description: The number of gateways created

outputs.name: gateway_ids
outputs.description: List of ids of the gateways created

outputs.name: gateways
outputs.description: List of ids and zones of gateways created

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the IBM Cloud resource group where the VPC has been provisioned.

variables.name: region
variables.description: The IBM Cloud region where the cluster will be/has been installed.

variables.name: vpc_name
variables.description: The name of the vpc instance

variables.name: zone_offset
variables.description: The offset for the zone where the subnet should be created. The default offset is 0 which means the first subnet should be created in zone xxx-1

variables.name: _count
variables.description: The number of subnets that should be provisioned

variables.name: label
variables.description: Label for the subnets created

variables.name: gateways
variables.description: List of gateway ids and zones

variables.name: ipv4_cidr_blocks
variables.description: List of ipv4 cidr blocks for the subnets that will be created (e.g. ['10.10.10.0/24']). If you are providing cidr blocks then a value must be provided for each of the subnets. If you don't provide cidr blocks for each of the subnets then values will be generated using the {ipv4_address_count} value.

variables.name: ipv4_address_count
variables.description: The size of the ipv4 cidr block that should be allocated to the subnet. If {ipv4_cidr_blocks} are provided then this value is ignored.

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the subnet should be provisioned. If 'false' then the subnet will be looked up.

variables.name: acl_rules
variables.description: List of rules to set on the subnet access control list

variables.name: tags
variables.description: Tags that should be added to the instance

outputs.name: count
outputs.description: The number of subnets created

outputs.name: ids
outputs.description: The ids of the created subnets

outputs.name: names
outputs.description: The ids of the created subnets

outputs.name: subnets
outputs.description: The subnets that were created

outputs.name: acl_id
outputs.description: The id of the network acl for the subnets

outputs.name: vpc_name
outputs.description: The name of the VPC where the subnets were provisioned

outputs.name: vpc_id
outputs.description: The id of the VPC where the subnets were provisioned

variables.description: The optional mode of operation for the VPN gateway. Valid values are route or policy

variables.name: ibmcloud_api_key
variables.description: The IBM Cloud api key

variables.name: region
variables.description: The IBM Cloud region where the resources will be provisioned.

variables.name: resource_label
variables.description: The label for the resource to which the vpe will be connected. Used as a tag and as part of the vpe name.

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the IBM Cloud resource group where the resources will be provisioned.

variables.name: certificate_manager_id
variables.description: The certificate manager instance id.

variables.name: vpc_id
variables.description: The id of the vpc instance.

variables.name: subnet_ids
variables.description: The array of ids (strings) for the subnet that the VPN will be connected to.

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The name of the vpn resource

variables.name: vpnclient_ip
variables.description: VPN Client IP Range

variables.name: client_dns
variables.description: Comma-separated DNS IPs for VPN Client Use ['161.26.0.10','161.26.0.11'] for public endpoints, or ['161.26.0.7','161.26.0.8'] for private endpoints

variables.name: auth_method
variables.description: VPN Client Auth Method. One of: certificate, username, certificate,username, username,certificate

variables.name: vpn_server_proto
variables.description: VPN Server Protocol. One of: udp or tcp

variables.name: vpn_server_port
variables.description: VPN Server Port number

variables.name: vpn_client_timeout
variables.description: VPN Server Client Time out

variables.name: enable_split_tunnel
variables.description: VPN server Tunnel Type

outputs.name: name
outputs.description: The name of the VPN server instance

outputs.name: server_certificate
outputs.description: The id of the server certificate saved to the certificate manager instance

outputs.name: client_certificate
outputs.description: The id of the client certificate saved to the certificate manager instance

outputs.name: vpn_profile
outputs.description: The id of the VPN server instance

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: Name of resource group in which to create the ssh key instance.

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: (Optional) Prefix used to name all resources. If not provided then resource_group_name is used.

variables.name: name
variables.description: (Optional) Name given to the ssh key instance. If not provided it will be generated using prefix_name

variables.name: label
variables.description: (Optional) Label used for the instance. It will be added to the name_prefix to create the name if the name is not provided.

variables.name: public_key
variables.description: The public key provided for the ssh key. If empty string is provided then a new key will be generated.

variables.name: private_key
variables.description: The private key provided for the ssh key. If empty string is provided then a new key will be generated.

variables.name: public_key_file
variables.description: The name of the file containing the public key provided for the ssh key. If empty string is provided then a new key will be generated.

variables.name: private_key_file
variables.description: The name of the file containing the private key provided for the ssh key. If empty string is provided then a new key will be generated.

variables.name: rsa_bits
variables.description: The number of bits for the rsa key, if it will be generated

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The id of the ssh key

outputs.name: public_key
outputs.description: The public key value in openssh format

outputs.name: private_key
outputs.description: The private key value

variables.name: resource_group_id
variables.description: The id of the IBM Cloud resource group where the VPC has been provisioned.

variables.name: region
variables.description: The IBM Cloud region where the cluster will be/has been installed.

variables.name: ibmcloud_api_key
variables.description: The IBM Cloud api token

variables.name: vpc_name
variables.description: The name of the vpc instance

variables.name: label
variables.description: The label for the server instance

variables.name: image_name
variables.description: The name of the image to use for the virtual server

variables.name: vpc_subnet_count
variables.description: Number of vpc subnets

variables.name: vpc_subnets
variables.description: List of subnets with labels

variables.name: profile_name
variables.description: Instance profile to use for the bastion instance

variables.name: ssh_key_id
variables.description: SSH key ID to inject into the virtual server instance

variables.name: allow_ssh_from
variables.description: An IP address, a CIDR block, or a single security group identifier to allow incoming SSH connection to the virtual server

variables.name: create_public_ip
variables.description: Set whether to allocate a public IP address for the virtual server instance

variables.name: init_script
variables.description: Script to run during the instance initialization. Defaults to an Ubuntu specific script when set to empty

variables.name: tags
variables.description: Tags that should be added to the instance

variables.name: kms_enabled
variables.description: Flag indicating that the volumes should be encrypted using a KMS.

variables.name: kms_key_crn
variables.description: The crn of the root key in the kms instance. Required if kms_enabled is true

variables.name: auto_delete_volume
variables.description: Flag indicating that any attached volumes should be deleted when the instance is deleted

variables.name: security_group_rules
variables.description: List of security group rules to set on the bastion security group in addition to the SSH rules

variables.name: allow_deprecated_image
variables.description: Flag indicating that deprecated images should be allowed for use in the Virtual Server instance. If the value is `false` and the image is deprecated then the module will fail to provision

variables.name: base_security_group
variables.description: The id of the base security group to use for the VSI instance. If not provided the default VPC security group will be used.

variables.name: acl_rules
variables.description: List of rules to set on the subnet access control list

variables.name: target_network_range
variables.description: The ip address range that should be used for the network acl rules generated from the security groups

outputs.name: output ids {
outputs.description: The instance ids

outputs.name: output names {
outputs.description: The instance names

outputs.name: security_group_id
outputs.description: The id of the security group that was created

outputs.name: security_group
outputs.description: The security group that was created

outputs.name: maintenance_security_group_id
outputs.description: The id of the security group that was used

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the key should be provisioned. If false then an existing key will be looked up

variables.name: kms_id
variables.description: The id of the kms instance. Required if kms_enabled is true

variables.name: kms_public_url
variables.description: The public url of the kms instance. Required if kms_enabled is true

variables.name: kms_private_url
variables.description: The private url of the kms instance. Required if kms_enabled is true

variables.name: name
variables.description: The name of the root key in the kms instance. Required if kms_enabled is true

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The name_prefix used to build the name if one is not provided. If used the name will be `{name_prefix}-{label}`

variables.name: label
variables.description: The label used to build the name if one is not provided. If used the name will be `{name_prefix}-{label}`

variables.name: rotation_interval
variables.description: The interval in months that a root key needs to be rotated.

variables.name: dual_auth_delete
variables.description: Flag indicating that the key requires dual authorization to be deleted.

variables.name: force_delete
variables.description: Flag indicating that 'force' should be applied to key on delete

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The id of the key

outputs.name: name
outputs.description: The crn of the key

outputs.description: The crn of the key

outputs.name: kms_id
outputs.description: The id of the kms instance

outputs.name: kms_public_url
outputs.description: The public url of the kms instance

outputs.name: kms_private_url
outputs.description: The private url of the kms instance

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the IBM Cloud resource group where the Certificate Manager instance will be/has been provisioned.

variables.name: kms_id
variables.description: The crn of the KMS instance that will be used to encrypt the instance.

variables.name: kms_key_crn
variables.description: The crn of the root key in the KMS

variables.name: kms_private_url
variables.description: The private url of the KMS instance that will be used to encrypt the instance.

variables.name: kms_public_url
variables.description: The public url of the KMS instance that will be used to encrypt the instance.

variables.name: region
variables.description: The region where the Certificate Manager will be/has been provisioned.

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The name prefix for the Certificate Manager resource. If not provided will default to resource group name.

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the instance should be provisioned. If false then an existing instance will be looked up

variables.name: kms_enabled
variables.description: Flag indicating that kms encryption should be enabled for this instance

variables.name: kms_private_endpoint
variables.description: Flag indicating the KMS private endpoint should be used

variables.name: name
variables.description: Name of the Certificate Manager. If not provided will be generated as $name_prefix-$label

variables.name: label
variables.description: Label used to build the Certificate Manager name if not provided.

variables.name: private_endpoint
variables.description: Flag indicating that the service should be access using private endpoints

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The Object Storage instance id

outputs.name: name
outputs.description: The Object Storage instance name

outputs.name: crn
outputs.description: The crn of the Object Storage instance

outputs.name: location
outputs.description: The Object Storage instance location

outputs.name: service
outputs.description: The name of the key provisioned for the Object Storage instance

outputs.name: label
outputs.description: The label used for the Object Storage instance

outputs.name: type
outputs.description: The type of the resource

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: The name of the IBM Cloud resource group where the VPC instance will be created.

variables.name: cos_instance_id
variables.description: id of the COS instance

variables.name: cos_key_id
variables.description: The id of the key provisioned for the COS instance

variables.name: kms_key_crn
variables.description: The crn of the root key in the KMS

variables.name: activity_tracker_crn
variables.description: The crn of the Activity Tracking instance

variables.name: metrics_monitoring_crn
variables.description: The crn of the Metrics Monitoring instance

variables.name: vpc_ip_addresses
variables.description: The list of ip addresses in the VPC that should be allowed to access the bucket.

variables.name: ibmcloud_api_key
variables.description: The IBM Cloud api token

variables.name: region
variables.description: Bucket region

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The name of the cos resource

variables.name: suffix
variables.description: Value added to the generated name to ensure it is unique

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the instance should be provisioned. If false then an existing instance will be looked up

variables.name: name
variables.description: Name of the bucket

variables.name: label
variables.description: Label used to build the bucket name of not provided.

variables.name: cross_region_location
variables.description: The cross-region location of the bucket. This value is optional. Valid values are (us, eu, and ap). This value takes precedence over others if provided.

variables.name: storage_class
variables.description: Storage class of the bucket. Supported values are standard, vault, cold, flex, smart.

variables.name: allowed_ip
variables.description: A list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses in CIDR notation that you want to allow access to your IBM Cloud Object Storage bucket.

variables.name: enable_object_versioning
variables.description: Object Versioning allows the COS user to keep multiple versions of an object in a bucket to protect against accidental deletion or overwrites. (Default = false)

outputs.name: bucket_name
outputs.description: The name of the COS bucket instance

outputs.name: id
outputs.description: The ID of the COS bucket instance

outputs.name: crn
outputs.description: The CRN of the COS bucket instance

variables.name: resource_group_name
variables.description: Resource group where the cluster has been provisioned.

variables.name: connections
variables.description: The list of vpc instance resource_crn to add network connections for.

variables.name: region
variables.description: Geographic location of the resource (e.g. us-south, us-east)

variables.name: name
variables.description: The name that should be used for the service, particularly when connecting to an existing service. If not provided then the name will be defaulted to {name prefix}-{service}

variables.name: name_prefix
variables.description: The prefix name for the service. If not provided it will default to the resource group name

variables.name: provision
variables.description: Flag indicating that the transit gateway must be provisioned
